markdownRemark.html:
“Mendicants, these nine people are found in the world. What nine? The perfected one and the one practicing for perfection. The non-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of non-return. The once-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of once-return. The stream-enterer and the one practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry. And the ordinary person. These are the nine people found in the world.”

AN.9.10. Āhuneyyasutta (“Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods”)

children.value:
“Mendicants, these nine people are found in the world.
What nine?
The perfected one and the one practicing for perfection. The non-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of non-return. The once-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of once-return. The stream-enterer and the one practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry. And the ordinary person.
These are the nine people found in the world.”
AN.9.10. Āhuneyyasutta (“Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods”)
